name: Path T Skin
title: Pathologic T
notes:
**Note 1:**  T1 and T2 categories are based on size and high risk features and not depth of invasion or extension. 

**Note 2:** T3 category is for head and neck skin primaries only.

**Note 3:**  Code the tumor with the greatest extension when there are multiple simultaneous tumors. 

**Note 4:**  Skin ulceration does not alter the T category. 

**Note 5:** Tumor size must be known to assign a value of T1 or T2. You may use a physician’s statement of the T category if this is the only information in the medical record.
* If the tumor appears to be in the T1 or T2 categories, but no size or category is specified, assign TX

**Note 6:** Assign the appropriate T category (T1, T2) based on the tumor size for the following descriptions

    Lesion(s) confined to dermis
    Subcutaneous tissue (through entire dermis)
    Underlying cartilage and/or skeletal muscle

    Confined to skin
    Localized, NOS
